thread.title: Local Roundup: Pacific volleyball looks for win at USF
thread.title_full: Local Roundup: Pacific volleyball looks for win at USF

author: The Record
title: Local Roundup: Pacific volleyball looks for win at USF
text: Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 12:01 AM By The Record Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 12:01 AM » Social News The Pacific volleyball team opens the second half of West Conference play at 1 p.m. today at USF. On Sept. 29, the Tigers (13-7, 4-5 WCC) started their WCC home schedule with a five-game victory over the Dons (16-6, 3-6) behind Lexi Elman, who had a season-high 29 kills. On Thursday, Pacific lost in five games at Santa Clara, while USF swept Saint Mary’s at home. Elman led the Tigers in kills for the 19th time this season with 17, while Holland Crenshaw had 13 kills and Janie Feldsher had 10 against the Broncos. Katarina Pilepic had 13 kills for the Dons against the Gaels. MEN’S WATER POLO Pacific 15, Bucknell 8 At Pacific, Aleksander Petrovic and Ben Stevenson each scored two goals in a balanced attack, and the No. 4 Tigers (18-2) won their 55th consecutive game against non-Mountain Pacific Sports Federation opponents. In goal, Brady Moore recorded five first-half saves, and Zach Paxton had three in the second half. Pacific will play host to No. 2 USC at noon Sunday. BOYS WATER POLO DeLong Tournament At Modesto, Bear Creek lost to Granite Bay 18-4. Jack Stensland and Dalin Nelson scored two goals each. In the afternoon game, the Bruins came back from a 7-3 deficit and beat Atwater-Buhach Colony 11-7. Stensland had six goals, and Kyle Fry and Mason Aguila had two each. • At Lincoln, the Trojans (17-2-2) beat Tracy 2-1 on two goals by Daniel Gamez. Anthony Galvan had an assist. Johon Garibay had 10 saves. Israel Oliveras scored for the Bulldogs (12-3-2). MEN’S TENNIS Pacific at Northwest Regionals At Seattle, the Tigers went 3-1 on the first day of the USTA/ITA Northwest Regional Championships. Daniel Alameh and Sem Verbeek won in singles with Verbeek and Miguel Diaz winning in doubles. Verbeek rallied from a first set loss to beat Washington’s Joao Barra 4-6, 6-2 6-2. Alameh needed a tie-breaker set against Brandon Sutter of Stanford, but prevailed 6-1, 7-6 (4), while Diaz fell to Jordan Smith of Gonzaga, 6-4, 1-6, 6-3. In doubles, Diaz and Verbeek downed Cal’s Billy Griffith and Wyatt Houghton, 8-6. WOMEN’S TENNIS Pacific at Northwest Regionals At Stanford, the Tigers went 3-2 on the first day of the ITA Women’s Northwest Regional Championships. Yuki Asami and Cristina Saenz de Buruaga Ruiz each won their their first-round matches and advanced together in doubles at Stanford’s Taube Family Tennis Stadium. In the singles Round of 128, freshman Yuki Asami beat Stanford’s Paulette Wolak 7-5, 6-2 in the morning, but lost in the Round of 64 to Cal’s Lyann Hoang, 7-5, 6-0. Saenz de Buruaga Ruiz beat Sacramento State’s Alina Soltanici 3-6, 6-2, 6-1, but lost to Stanford’s Caroline Lampl in the Round of 64, 6-2, 6-4. GIRLS TENNIS SJAA Tournament At Stockton, Lupita Barbosa of Stagg defeated Jamaicha Nelmida of Edison 6-3, 6-1 to capture the singles championship at In-Shape Sports Club-Marina. In the third-place match, Anaya Mayo of Bear Creek defeated Shirley Vang of Edison 10-4 in a pro-set. In the doubles competition, Vang and fellow Viking Zarah DeLeon defeated sisters Isela Pena and Selina Pena of Franklin 6-3, 6-4. By The Record
